cont.entity_a: Tack sharp with brilliant color and gorgeously round bokeh. Tack sharp even at F1.8. Very sharp and quick autofocus. Sharper and faster than Canon and Nikon lenses in this focal length. Incredibly bright, clear images.
cont.entity_b: Super sharp with slow focusing, manual focus recommended for macro. Amazing sharpness, saturation, color accuracy, and contrast.
Bokeh is outstanding when in focus on a tripod.

cont.entity_a: Not ideal for 'walk around' but perfect for studio headshots. Heavy lens but takes the best pictures on a tripod.
cont.entity_b: Extremely heavy, making handheld use difficult. Extremely heavy and slow focusing.

cont.entity_a: Can be used handheld in low light with built-in stabilization.
cont.entity_b: No image stabilization makes handheld macro near impossible.

cont.entity_a: Brighter colors and crisper than other Sony lenses.
cont.entity_b: Amazing sharpness, saturation, color accuracy, and contrast.

cont.entity_a: Ideal for portrait work and astrophotography.
cont.entity_b: Fantastic macro lens for Canon shooters. Takes great close-ups and portraits from a distance.
Hunts for focus at close range on non-contrasty subjects. Super sharp with slow focusing, manual focus recommended for macro.

cont.entity_a: Simply a beautiful lens with sharp and fast performance.
cont.entity_b: Excellent quality, in line with Canon L series expectations.

cont.entity_a: Takes the best pictures on a tripod.
